bitfield.description: Wrapper revision value
Software reset - Writing a one to this bit causes the CPGMACSS_R logic to be reset (INT, REGS, CPPI). Software reset occurs on the clock following the register bit write.
Subsystem Energy Efficient Ethernet enable 0: EEE disabled 1: EEE enabled
Configuration of the local initiator state management mode. By definition, initiator may generate read/write transaction as long as it is out of STANDBY state.

bitenum.description: Force-standby mode : Local initiator is unconditionally placed in standbystate.
No-standby mode : Local initiator is unconditionally placed out of standby state.

bitfield.description: Configuration of the local initiator state management mode. By definition, initiator may generate read/write transaction as long as it is out of IDLE state.

bitenum.description: Force-idle mode : Local initiator is unconditionally placed in idle state.
No-idle mode : Local initiator is unconditionally placed out of idle state.

bitfield.description: Interrupt Test - Test bit to the interrupt pacing blocks
Interrupt Pacing Enable INT_PACE_EN[0] – Enables RX_PULSE Pacing (0 is pacing bypass) INT_PACE_EN[1] – Enables TX_PULSE Pacing (0 is pacing bypass)
Interrupt Counter Prescaler - The number of MAIN_CLK periods in 4us.

register.description: Subsystem core 0 receive threshold int enable register

bitfield.description: Core 0 Receive Threshold Enable - Each bit in this register corresponds to the bit in the receive threshold interrupt that is enabled to generate an interrupt on RX_THRESH_PULSE.

register.description: Subsystem core 0 receive interrupt enable register

bitfield.description: Core 0 Receive Enable - Each bit in this register corresponds to the bit in the rx interrupt that is enabled to generate an interrupt on RX_PULSE.

register.description: Subsystem core 0 transmit interrupt enable register

bitfield.description: Core 0 Transmit Enable - Each bit in this register corresponds to the bit in the tx interrupt that is enabled to generate an interrupt on TX_PULSE.

register.description: Subsystem core 0 misc interrupt enable register

bitfield.description: Core 0 Misc Enable - Each bit in this register corresponds to the miscellaneous interrupt (SPF2_PEND, SPF1_PEND, EVNT_PEND, STAT_PEND, HOST_PEND, MDIO_LINKINT, MDIO_USERINT) that is enabled to generate an interrupt on MISC_PULSE.

register.description: Subsystem core 0 rx threshold masked int status register

bitfield.description: Core 0 Receive Threshold Masked Interrupt Status - Each bit in this read only register corresponds to the bit in the receive threshold interrupt that is enabled and generating an interrupt on RX_THRESH_PULSE.

register.description: Subsystem core 0 rx interrupt masked int status register

bitfield.description: Core 0 Receive Masked Interrupt Status - Each bit in this read only register corresponds to the bit in the Rx interrupt that is enabled and generating an interrupt on RX_PULSE.

register.description: Subsystem core 0 tx interrupt masked int status register

bitfield.description: Core 0 Transmit Masked Interrupt Status - Each bit in this read only register corresponds to the bit in the Tx interrupt that is enabled and generating an interrupt on TX_PULSE .

register.description: Subsystem core 0 misc interrupt masked int status register

bitfield.description: Core 0 Misc Masked Interrupt Status - Each bit in this register corresponds to the miscellaneous interrupt (SPF2_PEND, SPF1_PEND, EVNT_PEND, STAT_PEND, HOST_PEND, MDIO_LINKINT, MDIO_USERINT) that is enabled and generating an interrupt on MISC_PULSE .

register.description: Subsystem core 0 receive interrupts per millisecond

bitfield.description: Core 0 Receive Interrupts per Millisecond - The maximum number of interrupts per millisecond generated on RX_PULSE if pacing is enabled for this interrupt.

register.description: Subsystem core 0 transmit interrupts per millisecond

bitfield.description: Core 0 Transmit Interrupts per Millisecond - The maximum number of interrupts per millisecond generated on TX_PULSE if pacing is enabled for this interrupt.
RGMII 2 Fullduplex - This is the CPRGMII fullduplex output signal. 0 - Half-duplex mode 1 - Full-duplex mode
RGMII2 Speed - This is the CPRGMII speed output signal 0x0 - 10Mbps mode 0x1 - 100Mbps mode 0x2 - 1000Mbps (gig) mode 0x3 - reserved
RGMII2 Link Indicator - This is the CPRGMII link output signal 0 - RGMII2 link is down 1 - RGMII2 link is up
RGMII1 Fullduplex - This is the CPRGMII fullduplex output signal. 0 - Half-duplex mode 1 - Full-duplex mode
RGMII1 Speed - This is the CPRGMII speed output signal 0x0 - 10Mbps mode 0x1 - 100Mbps mode 0x2 - 1000Mbps (gig) mode 0x3 - reserved
RGMII1 Link Indicator - This is the CPRGMII link output signal 0 - RGMII1 link is down 1 - RGMII1 link is up
SPF2 Clockstop Acknowledge – When asserted the subsystem gated clock is not turned on due to SPF2.
SPF1 Clockstop Acknowledge – When asserted the subsystem gated clock is not turned on due to SPF1.
CPSW_3G Clockstop Acknowledge – When asserted the subsystem gated clock is not turned on due to the CPSW_3G.
